comment._content: It was a travesty. I'm 22 years old and a New Yorker. It breaks my heart to see the Penn Station that was.

comment.author: 23591833@N00
comment._content: They didn't think it was progress, even at the time everyone realized what a tragedy it was.  However, the station was privately owned, by the Pennsylvania Rail Company, which was bleeding red ink thanks the Robert Moses and the Interstate Highway Act.  The destroyed the station to get money, specifically a 25% stake in Madison Square Garden.  It was a business decision by a company that was failing and desperate to do anything to try to bring in revenue.

comment._content: This travesty started the landmark preservation trust to prevent things like this from ever happening again.
